sn30.7-16:0.3: 7–16. Ten Discourses On How Giving Helps to Become Egg-Born
sn30.7-16:1.2: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn30.7-16:1.3: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the egg-born phoenixes?”
sn30.7-16:1.4: “Mendicant, it’s when someone does both kinds of deeds by body, speech, and mind.
sn30.7-16:1.6: ‘The egg-born phoenixes are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
sn30.7-16:1.8: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the egg-born phoenixes!’
sn30.7-16:1.19: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the egg-born phoenixes.
sn30.7-16:1.20: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the egg-born phoenixes.”
